        public Gate()

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Calculates outputValue.

        Evaluates the output of the gate. Should only be called after enough inputs have been connected.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Get the name of the gate.
        Returns:
        A string containing the gate name.

      • setDelay

        public static void setDelay(int d)
        Set the delay of the Gate.
        Parameters:
        d - The delay in milliseconds.

      • getDelay

        public static int getDelay()
        Get the delay of the Gate.
        Returns:
        The delay in milliseconds.

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the name of the gate.
        Parameters:
        name - A string with the name you want to set.

      • getOutputValue

        public boolean getOutputValue()
        Gets the output value of the gate.

        Method for getting the updated output value of the gate in it's current state.

        Returns:
        The output value of the gate.

      • setInputGate

        public void setInputGate(Gate gate)
        Sets the input gates of the gate.

        This adds the supplied gate to the input variables of the gate. It also adds this gate to the output list of the provided gate.

        Parameters:
        gate - The gate to add as input.

      • getInputGates

        public java.util.List<Gate> getInputGates()
        Gets the connected input Gates.

        This provides a list of all the gates that provide input values for this gate.

        Returns:
        A list of input gates.

      • setOutputGate

        public void setOutputGate(Gate gate)
        Adds a gate to the outputGates list.

        This method adds a gate to the list of gates that will be notified when this gate changes it's output.

        Parameters:
        gate - The gate to be added to outputGates.

      • calculateValue

        public abstract boolean calculateValue()
        Calculated the output value of the gate from the input it receives.

        This function contains the logic of the Gate. It returns a boolean depending on the input values of the Gates in the inputGates list. calculateValue doesn't update the value of the gate, as this is handled elsewhere.

        Returns:
        boolean The the output state of the gate.
        Throws:
        GateException

      • inputChanged

        public abstract void inputChanged()
        Tells the Gate that the input has changed.

      • outputChanged

        protected void outputChanged(boolean output)
        Tells the gate that the output has changed and sets the new output value. Notifies all connected gates that it's output has changed.

        This method is responsible for notifying the dependent Gates that the current Gate has changed it's outputValue and they need to update theirs.

        Parameters:
        output - The new output value of the Gate.

      • createGates

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Gate> createGates(java.io.File file)
        createGates is a method that reads a custom file and "creates" the gates.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to parse from.
        Returns:
        LinkedHashMap with a gatenames as keys and their corresponding gates as values.
